notes: irregular present (so, sai, sa, sappiamo, sapete, sanno); used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'saputo'.
example_sentence_english: I want to know the truth.
Knowing this, I leave right away.
Did you know about the change?
You did not know the number.
Did you find out the news?

translation_english: he has found out/she has found out/you (formal) have found out
notes: used with auxiliary avere; also used as formal 'Lei'
example_sentence_english: He found out about the delay.
Did you find out about the course?

example_sentence_italian: Io seppi la verità solo dopo anni.
example_sentence_english: I knew the truth only after years.

notes: past historic, literary, not used in modern Italian

example_sentence_italian: Noi sapemmo la verità troppo tardi.
example_sentence_english: We learned the truth too late.

example_sentence_italian: Voi sapeste la risposta prima di me.
example_sentence_english: You (plural) knew the answer before me.

example_sentence_italian: Se io sapessi la risposta, te la direi.
example_sentence_english: If I knew the answer, I would tell you.

example_sentence_italian: Se tu sapessi cosa fare, aiuteresti.
example_sentence_english: If you (singular) knew what to do, you would help.

translation_english: he might know/she might know/you (formal) might know
example_sentence_italian: Se lui sapesse la verità, sarebbe triste.
example_sentence_english: If he knew the truth, he would be sad.

example_sentence_italian: Se noi sapessimo la soluzione, la diremmo.
example_sentence_english: If we knew the solution, we would say it.

example_sentence_italian: Sarei felice se voi sapeste la verità.
example_sentence_english: I would be happy if you (plural) knew the truth.
If they knew the truth, they would change their mind.

notes: passato remoto; irregular form; literary or less common in speech
example_sentence_english: I learned the truth after days.
